intro: Hesperis inodora, commonly known as sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its fragrant, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, round pods that contain seeds. Hesperis inodora prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a vibrant touch to gardens during that time.
